title: Will Anthem (ANTM) Surpass Q2 Earnings Expectations? - Analyst Blog
text:
Content preferences Done 
We expect health maintenance organization Anthem, Inc. ANTM to beat expectations when it reports   on Jul 29, 2015. Why a Likely Positive Surprise? Our proven model shows that Anthem is likely to beat earnings because it has the right combination of two key components. Zacks ESP: Earnings ESP, which represents the difference between   Estimate, is +1.49%. This is very meaningful and a leading indicator of a likely positive earnings surprise for shares. Zacks Rank: Anthem sports a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy). Note that stocks with Zacks Rank #1, 2 (Buy) or 3 (Hold) have a significantly higher chance of beating earnings. Conversely, the Sell-  should never be considered going into an   witnessing negative estimate revisions. The combination of Anthem’s Zacks Rank #1 and +1.49% ESP makes us confident of an earnings beat this season. What's Driving the Better-Than-Expected Earnings? Anthem’s successful divestitures, prudent capital management, modest cash position, strategic acquisitions and ACO arrangements bode well for it. Last quarter, the company collaborated with CareEvolution to make the cFHR (collaborative Family Health Record) app available for Apple Watch, a smartwatch developed by Apple Inc. AAPL. 
Being one of the first apps available on Apple Watch, this will give Anthem a competitive advantage in providing its suite of health plans and related notifications to consumers. In turn, this technological investment should help the company attract more customers, generate more revenues, thereby impacting earnings positively.Additionally, Anthem’s acquisition of Simply Healthcare Holdings has enhanced the Floridian operations of the company. Through the deal the company has emerged as one of the leaders serving the population of the state who are enrolled in Medicaid and Medicare programs. This should not only enhance the quality of care provided to existing customers, but also attract potential consumers and hence, contribute to the company’s income. 
Other Stocks to Consider 
Anthem is not the only stock looking up this earnings season. We see likely earnings beat coming from these two companies in the health care services sector as well:
